content: आस्था {c1c} <ab>U.</ab> {@--1@} To stand or remain on or by, to occupy. {@--2@} To ascend, mount; रथं, स्यंदनं &c. {@--3@} To use, have recourse to, resort to, practise, take, assume, follow; यथा यथा हि सद्वृत्तमातिष्ठंत्यनसूयकाः <ls>Ms. 10. 128</ls>, <ls n="Ms.">2. 133</ls>, <ls n="Ms.">10. 101</ls>; समाधिमास्थाय <ls>Ku. 5. 2</ls> practising concentration of mind; स्वरूपं <ls>Ku. 5. 84</ls> assuming his own form; तनुं <ls>Mu. 7. 19</ls>; <ls>R. 6. 72</ls>; कूर्मसंकोचं <ls>Pt. 3. 21</ls> contracting himself like a tortoise; पदमातस्थुषा <ls>Ku. 6. 72</ls> taking a place among; व्रतं <ls>Ve. 3. 19</ls>; so स्त्रीरूपं <ls>Pt. 3. 31</ls>; आस्थितविषादधियः <ls>Ki. 6. 29</ls> gloomy; <ls>Bg. 7. 20</ls>; <ls>K. 165</ls>; आस्थितविष्टरः <ls>R. 15. 79</ls>; सुहृदास्थितायां सभा यां <ls>Ku. 7. 29</ls>; विषमग्निं जलं रज्जुमा स्थास्ये तव कारणात् <ls>Mb.</ls> use; चिंतामौनमिवास्थिता <ls>V. 4. 38</ls> lost in moody abstraction. {@--4@} To do, perform, carry out. {@--5@} To recognise, acknowledge, own. {@--6@} To exhibit, aim at. {@--7@} To undertake, promise, agree. {@--8@} To behave. {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} {@--1@} To cause to stand. {@--2@} To hold fast, cling to. {@--3@} To collect, obtain. {@--4@} To place in, infix. {@--5@} To show, represent, introduce; प्रविश्य स्थापकस्तद्वत्काव्यमास्थापयेत्ततः <ls>S. D. 283</ls>; <ls>Mv. 1. 13.</ls> {@--6@} To step.

आस्था [आस्था-अङ्] {@--1@} Regard, care, respect, consideration, care for (with <ab>loc.</ab>); मर्त्येष्वास्थापराङ्मुखः <ls>R. 10. 43</ls>; मय्यप्यास्था न ते चेत् <ls>Bh. 3. 30</ls>; <ls n="Bh.">2. 98</ls>; see अनास्था also. {@--2@} Assent, promise. {@--3@} Prop, support, stay. {@--4@} Hope, confidence; जयलक्ष्म्यां बबंधास्थां <ls>Rāj. T. 5. 245.</ls> {@--5@} An effort. {@--6@} State, condition. {@--7@} An assembly. {@--8@} A place or means of abiding.
